TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TaskLoggingHelper extends System.MarshalByRefObject

Docs.summary: Provides helper logging methods used by tasks.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows the code for a task that creates one or more directories.
[!code-csharp[msbuild_MakeDirTask#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Misc/msbuild_MakeDirTask/CS/msbuild_MakeDirTask.cs#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public TaskLoggingHelper (Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITask taskInstance);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITask taskInstance) cil managed

Docs.param: The task containing an instance of this task.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and associates it with the specified task instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public TaskLoggingHelper (Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine buildEngine, string taskName);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine buildEngine, string taskName) cil managed

Docs.param: The build engine.
The task name.
Docs.summary: Public constructor which can be used by task factories to assist them in logging messages.

MemberSignature.Value: protected Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine BuildEngine { get; }
.property instance class Microsoft.Build.Framework.IBuildEngine BuildEngine

Docs.summary: Gets the build engine that is associated with the task.
Docs.value: An that represents the instance of the build engine that is associated with the task.

MemberSignature.Value: public string ExtractMessageCode (string message, out string messageWithoutCodePrefix);
.method public hidebysig instance string ExtractMessageCode(string message, string messageWithoutCodePrefix) cil managed

Docs.param: The full message to parse that includes code prefix.
The message with the code prefix removed.
Docs.summary: Extracts the message code prefix from the given full message string.
Docs.returns: The message code prefix that is extracted from the full message string, or if there is no message code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Message code prefixes must match the following .NET regular expressions in order to be recognized: `^\s*[A-Za-z]+\d+:\s*`.
## Examples If this method is given the full message string `MYTASK1001: This is an error message.` and it accepts `This is an error message.` as the value for the `messageWithoutCodePrefix` parameter, then it returns `MYTASK1001`.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string FormatResourceString (string resourceName, object[] args);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string FormatResourceString(string resourceName, object[] args) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the string resource to load.
Optional arguments for formatting the loaded string.
Docs.summary: Loads the specified resource string and optionally formats it using the given arguments.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The culture of the current thread is used for formatting.
This method requires the owner task to have registered its resources with either the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.TaskResources%2A> property.

Docs.exception: The string resource indicated by does not exist.
The property of the owner task is not set.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string FormatString (string unformatted, object[] args);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string FormatString(string unformatted, object[] args) cil managed

Docs.param: The string to format.
Arguments for formatting.
Docs.summary: Formats the given string using the given arguments.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The culture of the current thread is used for formatting.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetResourceMessage(string resourceName) cil managed

Docs.param: The resource name.
Docs.summary: Gets the message from resource in task library.
Docs.returns: Returns the message from resource in task library.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool HasLoggedErrors { get; }
.property instance bool HasLoggedErrors

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the task has logged any errors through this logging helper object.
Docs.value: if the task has logged any errors through this logging helper object; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows the code for a task that creates one or more directories.

MemberSignature.Value: public string HelpKeywordPrefix { get; set; }
.property instance string HelpKeywordPrefix

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the prefix used to compose Help keywords from resource names.
Docs.value: The prefix used to compose Help keywords from resource names.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If a task does not have Help keywords associated with its messages, it can ignore this property or set it to `null`. If this property is set to an empty <xref:System.String>, resource names will be used verbatim as Help keywords.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object InitializeLifetimeService ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance object InitializeLifetimeService() cil managed

Docs.summary:
InitializeLifetimeService is called when the remote object is activated.
This method will determine how long the lifetime for the object will be.
Thread safe. However, InitializeLifetimeService and MarkAsInactive should only be called in that order, together or not at all, and no more than once.
Docs.returns: The lease object to control this object's lifetime.

Docs.param: The command line string.
Docs.summary: Logs the command line for an underlying tool, executable file, or shell command of a task.

MemberSignature.Value: public void LogCriticalMessage (string subcategory, string code, string helpKeyword, string file, int lineNumber, int columnNumber, int endLineNumber, int endColumnNumber, string message, object[] messageArgs);

.method public hidebysig instance void LogCriticalMessage(string subcategory, string code, string helpKeyword, string file, int32 lineNumber, int32 columnNumber, int32 endLineNumber, int32 endColumnNumber, string message, object[] messageArgs) cil managed

Docs.param: Description of the warning type (can be null).
Message code (can be null).
The help keyword for the host IDE (can be null).
The path to the file causing the message (can be null).
The line in the file causing the message (set to zero if not available).
The column in the file causing the message (set to zero if not available).
The last line of a range of lines in the file causing the message (set to zero if not available).
The last column of a range of columns in the file causing the message (set to zero if not available).
The message string.
Optional arguments for formatting the message string.
Docs.summary:
Logs a critical message using the specified string and other message details.
Thread safe.
Logs an error.

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: public void LogError (string subcategory, string errorCode, string helpKeyword, string file, int lineNumber, int columnNumber, int endLineNumber, int endColumnNumber, string message, object[] messageArgs);

.method public hidebysig instance void LogError(string subcategory, string errorCode, string helpKeyword, string file, int32 lineNumber, int32 columnNumber, int32 endLineNumber, int32 endColumnNumber, string message, object[] messageArgs) cil managed

Docs.param: The description of the error type.
The error code.
The Help keyword to associate with the error.
The path to the file containing the error.
The line in the file where the error occurs.
The column in the file where the error occurs.
The end line in the file where the error occurs.
The end column in the file where the error occurs.
The message.
Optional arguments for formatting the message string.
Docs.summary: Logs an error using the specified message and other error details.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The parameters `subCategory`, `errorCode`, `helpKeyword`, and `file` can be `null`.
The parameters `lineNumber`, `columnNumber`, `endLineNumber`, and `endColumnNumber` should be set to 0 if they are not available.

MemberSignature.Value: public void LogErrorWithCodeFromResources (string messageResourceName, object[] messageArgs);
.method public hidebysig instance void LogErrorWithCodeFromResources(string messageResourceName, object[] messageArgs) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
Docs.summary: Logs an error with an error code using the specified resource string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the message begins with an error code, the code is extracted and logged with the message.
If a Help keyword prefix has been provided, it is also logged with the message. The Help keyword is composed by appending the string resource name to the Help keyword prefix. A task can provide a Help keyword prefix with either the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.HelpKeywordPrefix%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public void LogErrorWithCodeFromResources (string subcategoryResourceName, string file, int lineNumber, int columnNumber, int endLineNumber, int endColumnNumber, string messageResourceName, object[] messageArgs);

The path to the file containing the error.
The line in the file where the error occurs.
The column in the file where the error occurs.
The end line in the file where the error occurs.
The end column in the file where the error occurs.
The name of the string resource to load.
The arguments for formatting the loaded string.
Docs.summary: Logs an error using the specified resource string and other error details.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the message begins with an error code, the code is extracted and logged with the message.
If a Help keyword prefix has been provided, it is also logged with the message. The Help keyword is composed by appending the string resource name to the Help keyword prefix. A task can provide a Help keyword prefix with either the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task> base class constructor, or the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Task.HelpKeywordPrefix%2A> property.
The parameters `subCategoryResourceName`, and `file` can be `null`.
The parameters `lineNumber`, `columnNumber`, `endLineNumber`, and `endColumnNumber` should be set to 0 if they are not available.

MemberSignature.Value: public void MarkAsInactive ();
.method public hidebysig instance void MarkAsInactive() cil managed

Docs.summary: Notifies this that it is no longer needed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is thread safe, however, you must call both InitializeLifetimeService and MarkAsInactive, in that order, or you must call neither method, and you must call neither method than once.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Resources.ResourceManager TaskResources { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Resources.ResourceManager TaskResources

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the culture-specific resources used by the logging methods.
Docs.value: A that represents the culture-specific resources used by the logging methods. This value can be .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If derived classes have localized strings, then they should register their resources with this property.
